org.artoolkitx.arx.arxj

Class NativeInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.artoolkitx.arx.arxj.NativeInterface

  • public class NativeInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    The NativeInterface class contains the JNI function signatures for native ARToolKit functions. These functions should be accessed via the ARToolKit class rather than called directly.

        public NativeInterface()

    • Method Detail

      • loadNativeLibrary

        public static boolean loadNativeLibrary()
        Attempts to load the native library so that native functions can be called.
        Returns:
        true if the library was successfully loaded, otherwise false.

      • arwGetARToolKitVersion

        public static java.lang.String arwGetARToolKitVersion()
        Gets the version of the underlying ARToolKit library.
        Returns:
        ARToolKit version

      • arwInitialiseAR

        public static boolean arwInitialiseAR()
        Initialises the basic ARToolKit functions. After this function has been successfully called, markers can be added and removed, but marker detection is not yet running.
        Returns:
        true on success, false if an error occurred

      • arwInitialiseARWithOptions

        public static boolean arwInitialiseARWithOptions(int pattSize,
                                                 int pattCountMax)
        Initialises the the basic ARToolKit functions with non-default options for size and number of square markers. After this function has been successfully called, markers can be added and removed, but marker detection is not yet running.
        Parameters:
        pattSize - For any square template (pattern) markers, the number of rows and columns in the template. May not be less than 16 or more than AR_PATT_SIZE1_MAX. Pass AR_PATT_SIZE1 for the same behaviour as arwInitialiseAR().
        pattCountMax - For any square template (pattern) markers, the maximum number of markers that may be loaded for a single matching pass. Must be > 0. Pass AR_PATT_NUM_MAX for the same behaviour as arwInitialiseAR().
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if an error occurred
        See Also:
        arwShutdownAR()

      • arwChangeToResourcesDir

        public static boolean arwChangeToResourcesDir(java.lang.String resourcesDirectoryPath)
        Changes the working directory to the resources directory used by ARToolKit. Normally, this would be called immediately after arwInitialiseAR()
        Returns:
        true if successful, false if an error occurred
        See Also:
        arwInitialiseAR()

      • arwStartRunning

        public static boolean arwStartRunning(java.lang.String vconf,
                                      java.lang.String cparaName,
                                      float nearPlane,
                                      float farPlane)
        Initialises video capture. The native library will start to expect video frames.
        Parameters:
        vconf - The video configuration string. Can be left empty.
        cparaName - Either: null to search for camera parameters specific to the device, or a path (in the filesystem) to a camera parameter file. The path may be an absolute path, or relative to the resourcesDirectoryPath set with arwChangeToResourcesDir.
        nearPlane - The value to use for the near OpenGL clipping plane.
        farPlane - The value to use for the far OpenGL clipping plane.
        Returns:
        true on success, false if an error occurred.

      • arwStartRunningStereo

        public static boolean arwStartRunningStereo(java.lang.String vconfL,
                                            java.lang.String cparaNameL,
                                            java.lang.String vconfR,
                                            java.lang.String cparaNameR,
                                            java.lang.String transL2RName,
                                            float nearPlane,
                                            float farPlane)
        Initialises stereo video capture. The native library will start to expect video frames.
        Parameters:
        vconfL - The video configuration string for the left camera. Can be left empty.
        cparaNameL - The camera parameter file to load for the left camera.
        vconfR - The video configuration string for the right camera. Can be left empty.
        cparaNameR - The camera parameter file to load for the right camera.
        transL2RName - The stereo calibration file to load.
        nearPlane - The value to use for the near OpenGL clipping plane.
        farPlane - The value to use for the far OpenGL clipping plane.
        Returns:
        true on success, false if an error occurred

      • arwIsRunning

        public static boolean arwIsRunning()
        Queries whether marker detection is up and running. This will be true after a call to arwStartRunning, and frames are being sent through. At this point, marker visibility and transformations can be queried.
        Returns:
        true if marker detection is running, false if not

      • arwStopRunning

        public static boolean arwStopRunning()
        Stops marker detection and closes the video source.
        Returns:
        true on success, false if an error occurred

      • arwShutdownAR

        public static boolean arwShutdownAR()
        Shuts down the basic ARToolKit functions.
        Returns:
        true on success, false if an error occurred

      • arwGetProjectionMatrix

        public static float[] arwGetProjectionMatrix()
        Retrieves the ARToolKit projection matrix.
        Returns:
        A float array containing the OpenGL compatible projection matrix, or null if an error occurred.

      • arwGetProjectionMatrixStereo

        public static boolean arwGetProjectionMatrixStereo(float[] projL,
                                                   float[] projR)
        Retrieves the ARToolKit projection matrix for the right camera of a stereo camera pair.
        Returns:
        A float array containing the OpenGL compatible projection matrix, or null if an error occurred.

      • arwGetVideoParams

        public static boolean arwGetVideoParams(int[] width,
                                        int[] height,
                                        int[] pixelSize,
                                        java.lang.String[] pixelFormatStringBuffer)
        Returns the parameters of the video source frame.

        Usage example: int[] width = new int[1]; int[] height = new int[1]; int[] pixelSize = new int[1]; String[] pixelFormatString = new String[1]; boolean ok = NativeInterface.arwGetVideoParams(width, height, pixelSize, pixelFormatString);

        Returns:
        True if the values were returned OK, false if there is currently no video source or an error int[] .
        See Also:
        arwGetVideoParamsStereo

      • arwGetVideoParamsStereo

        public static boolean arwGetVideoParamsStereo(int[] widthL,
                                              int[] heightL,
                                              int[] pixelSizeL,
                                              java.lang.String[] pixelFormatStringL,
                                              int[] widthR,
                                              int[] heightR,
                                              int[] pixelSizeR,
                                              java.lang.String[] pixelFormatString)
        Returns the parameters of the video source frames.

        Usage example: int[] widthL = new int[1]; int[] heightL = new int[1]; int[] pixelSizeL = new int[1]; String[] pixelFormatStringL = new String[1]; int[] widthR = new int[1]; int[] heightR = new int[1]; int[] pixelSizeR = new int[1]; String[] pixelFormatStringR = new String[1]; boolean ok = NativeInterface.arwGetVideoParams(widthL, heightL, pixelSizeL, pixelFormatStringL, widthR, heightR, pixelSizeR, pixelFormatStringR);

        Returns:
        True if the values were returned OK, false if there is currently no stereo video source or an error occurred.
        See Also:
        arwGetVideoParams

      • arwCapture

        public static boolean arwCapture()
        Checks if a new video frame is available.
        Returns:
        true if a new frame is available.

      • arwUpdateAR

        public static boolean arwUpdateAR()
        Performs an update, runs marker detection if in the running state.
        Returns:
        true if no error occurred, otherwise false

      • arwUpdateTexture32

        public static boolean arwUpdateTexture32(byte[] image)

      • arwUpdateTextureStereo32

        public static boolean arwUpdateTextureStereo32(byte[] imageL,
                                               byte[] imageR)

      • arwAddMarker

        public static int arwAddMarker(java.lang.String cfg)
        Adds a marker to be detected.
        Parameters:
        cfg - Marker configuration string
        Returns:
        A unique identifier (UID) of the new marker, or -1 if the marker was not added due to an error.

      • arwRemoveMarker

        public static boolean arwRemoveMarker(int markerUID)
        Removes the specified marker.
        Parameters:
        markerUID - The unique identifier (UID) of the marker to remove
        Returns:
        true if the marker was removed, otherwise false

      • arwRemoveAllMarkers

        public static int arwRemoveAllMarkers()
        Removes all loaded markers.
        Returns:
        The number of markers removed

      • arwQueryMarkerVisibility

        public static boolean arwQueryMarkerVisibility(int markerUID)
        Queries whether the specified marker is currently visible.
        Parameters:
        markerUID - The unique identifier (UID) of the marker to check
        Returns:
        true if the marker is currently visible, otherwise false

      • arwQueryMarkerTransformation

        public static float[] arwQueryMarkerTransformation(int markerUID)
        Retrieves the transformation matrix for the specified marker
        Parameters:
        markerUID - The unique identifier (UID) of the marker to check
        Returns:
        A float array containing the OpenGL compatible transformation matrix, or null if the marker isn't visible or an error occurred.

      • arwQueryMarkerTransformationStereo

        public static boolean arwQueryMarkerTransformationStereo(int markerUID,
                                                         float[] matrixL,
                                                         float[] matrixR)
        Retrieves the transformation matrix for the specified marker
        Parameters:
        markerUID - The unique identifier (UID) of the marker to check
        matrixL - A float array containing the OpenGL compatible transformation matrix for the left camera.
        matrixR - A float array containing the OpenGL compatible transformation matrix for the right camera.
        Returns:
        true if the marker is currently visible, otherwise false.

                                            int option)

      • arwSetVideoDebugMode

        public static void arwSetVideoDebugMode(boolean debug)
        Sets whether to enable or disable debug mode.
        Parameters:
        debug - true to enable, false to disable

      • arwGetVideoDebugMode

        public static boolean arwGetVideoDebugMode()
        Returns whether debug mode is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if enabled, otherwise false

      • arwAndroidVideoPushInit

        public static int arwAndroidVideoPushInit(int videoSourceIndex,
                                          int width,
                                          int height,
                                          java.lang.String pixelFormat,
                                          int camera_index,
                                          int camera_face)
        Tells the native library the source and size and format in which video frames will be pushed. This call may only be made after a call to arwStartRunning or arwStartRunningStereo.
        Parameters:
        videoSourceIndex - Zero-based index of the video source which is being initialized for pushing. Normally 0, but for the second camera in a stereo pair, 1.
        width - Width of the video frame in pixels.
        height - Height of the video frame in pixels.
        pixelFormat - string with format in which buffers will be pushed. Supported values include "NV21", "NV12", "YUV_420_888", "RGBA", "RGB_565", and "MONO".
        camera_index - Zero-based index into the devices's list of cameras. If only one camera is present on the device, will be 0.
        camera_face - 0 if camera is rear-facing (the default) or 1 if camera is facing toward the user.
        Returns:
        0 if no error occurred, otherwise an error value less than 0.

      • arwAndroidVideoPush1

        public static int arwAndroidVideoPush1(int videoSourceIndex,
                                       byte[] buf,
                                       int bufSize)
        Pushes a video frame to the native library (single-planar). May only be made after calling arwAndroidVideoPushInit and may not be made after a call to arwAndroidVideoPushFinal.
        Parameters:
        videoSourceIndex - Zero-based index of the video source which is being pushed. Normally 0, but for the second camera in a stereo pair, 1.
        buf - Reference to a byte buffer holding the frame data. This will be the only plane.
        bufSize - The length (in bytes) of the buffer referred to by buf.
        Returns:
        0 if no error occurred, otherwise an error value less than 0.

      • arwAndroidVideoPush2

        public static int arwAndroidVideoPush2(int videoSourceIndex,
                                       java.nio.ByteBuffer buf0,
                                       int buf0PixelStride,
                                       int buf0RowStride,
                                       java.nio.ByteBuffer buf1,
                                       int buf1PixelStride,
                                       int buf1RowStride,
                                       java.nio.ByteBuffer buf2,
                                       int buf2PixelStride,
                                       int buf2RowStride,
                                       java.nio.ByteBuffer buf3,
                                       int buf3PixelStride,
                                       int buf3RowStride)
        Pushes a video frame to the native library. May only be made after calling arwAndroidVideoPushInit and may not be made after a call to arwAndroidVideoPushFinal.
        Parameters:
        videoSourceIndex - Zero-based index of the video source which is being pushed. Normally 0, but for the second camera in a stereo pair, 1.
        buf0 - For interleaved formats (e.g. RGBA), reference to a byte buffer holding the frame data. For interleaved formats this will be the only plane. For planar formats, reference to a byte buffer holding plane 0 of the frame. For planar NV21 and YUV_420_888 formats, this will be the luma plane.
        buf0Size - The length (in bytes) of the buffer referred to by buf0.
        buf1 - For planar formats consisting of 2 or more planes, reference to a byte buffer holding plane 1 of the frame. For planar NV21 image format, this will be the chroma plane. For planar YUV_420_888 format, this will be the Cb chroma plane.
        buf1Size - The length (in bytes) of the buffer referred to by buf1.
        buf2 - For planar formats consisting 3 or more planes, reference to a byte buffer holding plane 2 of the frame. For planar YUV_420_888 format, this will be the Cr chroma plane.
        buf2Size - The length (in bytes) of the buffer referred to by buf2.
        buf3 - For planar formats consisting of 4 planes, reference to a byte buffer holding plane 3 of the frame.
        buf3Size - The length (in bytes) of the buffer referred to by buf3.
        Returns:
        0 if no error occurred, otherwise an error value less than 0.

      • arwAndroidVideoPushFinal

        public static int arwAndroidVideoPushFinal(int videoSourceIndex)
        Tells the native library that no further frames will be pushed. This call may only be made before a call to arwStopRunning.
        Parameters:
        videoSourceIndex - Zero-based index of the video source which is being finalized for pushing. Normally 0, but for the second camera in a stereo pair, 1.
        Returns:
        0 if no error occurred, otherwise an error value less than 0.
